title: Ken Brown 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This appellation blend is rich and lush with baked black-cherry aromas, touches of black cardamom and clove spice, and earthy rhubarb and beet notes. The palate packs a lot of forest-floor flavors, from loam to pine needles, into dark cranberry and tight raspberry fruit, leveled by pepper and pencil lead.

title: Chronic Cellars 2013 The Unteachables Red (Paso Robles)
description: A ragtag blend of the darkest grapes, specifically 34% Tannat, 34% Petite Sirah, 20% Syrah and 12% Zinfandel, this wine has a nose that expertly integrates black pepper, plum, soy, chopped violets and blackberry puree. Black currant, black pepper and charred beef arise once sipped, with a touch of licorice to round out the spice.

title: Carpineto 2014  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: This savory red opens with aromas that recall underbrush, dark berry, spice and a hint of new leather. The easy-drinking, juicy palate offers wild cherry, raspberry and a dash of baking spice alongside polished tannins and lively acidity.

title: Castellare di Castellina 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Fragrant purple flower, dark-skinned berry, eucalyptus and aromatic herb aromas lead the way. The bright, no-frills palate offers sour cherry, chopped mint and a hint of clove while lithe tannins add polish. Drink through 2017.

title: Castello della Paneretta 2013  Chianti Classico
description: This offers aromas that recall red berry, moist soil and a whiff of clove. The vibrant palate delivers juicy wild cherry, blackberry, chopped herb and anise alongside lively acidity and polished tannins.

title: Castello di Monterinaldi 2013  Chianti Classico
description: This opens with aromas that recall wild berry, tilled soil, spice and a hint of leather. On the sleek, straightforward palate, supple tannins and vibrant acidity underscore wild cherry, star anise and chopped herb.

title: Castello di Querceto 2012 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This opens with warm aromas suggesting coffee, toast, espresso, baked plum and a hint of nutmeg. The ripe, fleshy palate doles out mature black cherry framed in close-grained tannins. Notes of cinnamon, cocoa and orange zest give it a touch of the exotic.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Patamar Reserva Red (Douro)
description: Named after the terraces (Patamares) on which the vines are planted in the Douro, the wine is a classic blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. Firmly structured and still young, the wine is rich with blackberry and black plum skin flavors. There is a dry core that will soften. Drink from 2017.

title: Château Coutinel 2014 Red (Fronton)
description: With a blend that is dominated by Négrette, Fronton's star red grape, this wine is ripe, firm and young with boisterous tannins and red berry fruits. It is perfumed, still dry and needing time to develop its ripe fruits. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.

title: Château de Bellevue 2014  Brouilly
description: This is a bold ripe black cherry flavored wine from a 19th century estate close to the Morgon appellation. Like many Brouilly, this is soft and fruity, freshened by acidity and lightly structured. It could be aged, but it is just ready to drink now for its balance between tannins and bright fruit.

title: Alma Rosa 2014 Pinot Gris (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling from Richard Sanford's label shows apples, orange rind, scratched lime and tonic notes on the nose. Once sipped, the intriguing texture is grippy, the flavors are tightly wound and the finish is mouthwatering, with lemon, lime pith and kumquat elements.

title: Barone Ricasoli 2013 Brolio Bettino  (Chianti Classico)
description: Dark-skinned berry, menthol, dark cooking spice and aromatic herb aromas unfold on this. The fresh, juicy palate offers dried black cherry, red currant, coffee and licorice alongside smooth, polished tannins. Enjoy through 2019.

title: Barone Ricasoli 2013 Brolio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Scents of black currant, green bell pepper, cedar and a hint of violet slowly emerge in the glass. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, toast, coffee, mocha and a touch of vanilla alongside polished, fine-grained tannins.

title: Baxter 2013 Run Dog Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine has a deep color, strong fruity aromas and substantial fruit flavors. Full bodied and moderately tannic, it has a good, grippy mouthfeel and honest black-cherry and plum notes. Tasty now it will improve through 2018 or so.

title: Monteraponi 2014  Chianti Classico
description: Fermented without selected yeasts or temperature control, this bright, savory blend of 95% Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo opens with classic varietal aromas of red berry, fragrant blue flower and a whiff of new leather. The fresh, easy drinking palate doles out juicy wild cherry, chopped herb and a hint cinnamon offset by vibrant acidity and supple tannins. Drink through 2017.

title: Nagy 2012 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of beach tar and blackberry jam show on the nose of this wine from White Hawk Vineyard by Clarissa Nagy, also winemaker at Riverbench. The palate is also quite tarry, with concentrated blackberry flavors, hints of teriyaki and a strong acidic backbone.

title: Kriselle 2013 Di'tani Red (Rogue Valley)
description: Roughly half Cab Franc, this includes Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Tempranillo as well. Here the fruit is accented, not overtaken, with the flavors of barrels. The best of the winery's red wines, it augments its pretty cherry core with a streak of coffee and dark chocolate.

title: Kunde 2012 Meritage 202 Meritage (Sonoma Valley)
description: A majority of Cabernet Sauvignon makes up this wine, blended with 14% Malbec, 14% Merlot, 10% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc. Thick and velvety with strong notes of dark chocolate, espresso and brambly blackberry, it has a juicy middle before finishing fairly flat.

title: R. Stuart & Co. 2013 Big Fire Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Add this bottling to the growing list of worthy Oregon Pinots under $20. Light and balanced, it offers spicy cranberry and rhubarb with a streak of red licorice. It's a good everyday wine for salmon and light poultry dishes.

title: Star Lane Vineyard 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A tad earthier than other bottlings from the area, this shows damp herbs, forest-floor notes and soy on the nose, backed up by the stewed black-plum fruit. The tannins are soft but present on the palate, where teriyaki flavors mesh with elderberry, oregano and dark chocolate. This will improve with more bottle age.

title: Tassi 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Aromas of toast, scorched earth, leather, dried herb and a balsamic note emerge on this solid, brawny red. The warm, chewy palate delivers raspberry compote, chopped mint, dried sage, coffee and licorice framed in close-grained, drying tannins. You'll also notice the wallop of evident alcohol. It shows the heat of the vintage so drink sooner rather than later.

title: Robert Hall 2013 Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: On the juicy nose, this bottling shows Concord grape, suave violet and lilac flowers and the slightest touch of tar. It's lighter in body and quite easy to quaff, with flavors of sea-salt caramel and dense olallieberry.

title: Tenuta Vitanza 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Scents of mature wild berry, fragrant iris, chopped mint and a hint of leather come together on this. The round, no-frills palate offers up dried black cherry, anise and clove alongside mature, loosely knit tannins. It's already extremely accessible.

title: San Felice 2013  Chianti Classico
description: This lively red opens with aromas of wild berry, blue flower and a whiff of tilled soil. The vibrant, straightforward palate offers juicy red cherry, strawberry and a hint of nutmeg alongside sleek tannins and racy acidity. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon.

title: Season 2014 Transparency White (Southern Oregon)
description: This flavorful blend of Müller-Thurgau, Muscat and Riesling is lightly fizzy, and off dry, with residual sugar listed at 22.5g/L. Citrus fruits are limned with ginger, and it is a thoroughly refreshing and low-alcohol delight.

title: Echeverria 2013 Gran Reserva Carmenère (Curicó Valley)
description: Plum, black cherry, sandalwood and spice aromas work well together. This feels well balanced. Spicy, minty plum and berry aromas are common for Carmenère, while a chewy finish is smooth and not demanding.

title: Enate 2009 Crianza Red (Somontano)
description: This blend of 75% Tempranillo and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon opens with dry, earthy, spicy aromas of tomato, red plum and horse hide. It's racy and lifted on the palate, with good balance. Flavors of olive, herbs, spice and red-berry fruits are slightly green, while this is chocolaty and lightly oaky on the finish.

title: Iris Vineyards 2014 Aroha Vineyard Merlot (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is impressively dark, with dense but grapy fruit flavors right out front. The mouthfeel is sharp and spicy, and it thins out surprisingly in the middle, given the color and rather high alcohol. Sappy acids and raspy tannins carry it through the finish.

title: Francis Ford Coppola 2012 Reserve Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)
description: This is an approachable, soft and relatively light-bodied version of the variety, tamed for present-day consumption and enjoyment. Chocolate-covered blueberries and maple syrup provide decadence, brightened by the presence of kirsch.

title: Gracciano della Seta 2014  Rosso di Montepulciano
description: Made with 95% Sangiovese and 5% Merlot, this straightforward wine has restrained aromas of red berry, menthol and a hint of earth. The palate is a bit more expressive, offering mouthwatering Morello cherry and eucalyptus. Bright acidity and mellow tannins underscore the juicy fruit.
